paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** NiFi to HDFS to Hive
**Objective:** Use NiFi to import data into HDFS. Load data into Hive ORC tables
**File locations:** hostname:/tmp/cloudair hdfs:///data/cloudair
**Successful outcome:** Practice with using NiFi and Hive ORC tables
**Before you begin:** Ensure data is available in the local file system
**Related lessons:** Introducing NiFi and The Data Life Cycle

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: NiFi to HDFS to Hive
Objective: Use NiFi to import data into HDFS. Load data into Hive ORC tables
File locations: hostname:/tmp/cloudair hdfs:///data/cloudair
Successful outcome: Practice with using NiFi and Hive ORC tables
Before you begin: Ensure data is available in the local file system
Related lessons: Introducing NiFi and The Data Life Cycle

paragraphs.title: Check cloudair db
paragraphs.text:
%sh
export PGPASSWORD='BadPass%1'; psql -h db01.cloudair.lan -U devuser -d cloudair -p 5432  <<EOF
\dt
EOF

paragraphs.title: 1 - Run NiFi Process Group Import from DB to HDFS Grp
paragraphs.text:
%md
Go to Ambari
Select NiFi 
Select Quickstart for NiFi
Select NiFi Process Group DFLOW 
Explore Process Group Import from DB to HDFS Grp
Return to the DFLOW canvas
Enable the services for Import from DB to HDFS Grp
- right-click process group Import from DB to HDFS Grp
- select Configure
- select the Controller Services tab
- For each service:
    - click on the lightning bolt icon
    - select Enable from the pop-up window
    - once the service has been enabled, you can close the window
    - close the configuration window

Run Process Group Import from DB to HDFS Grp
- you will stop this process group at the end of this notebook

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Create and load data into production table sale

msg.data: Create and load data into production table sale

paragraphs.title: 9 - Create table sale_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.sale_stage;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE cloudair.sale_stage(
    `entry_date` DATE,
    `item` STRING,
    `sales_code` INT,
    `cc_type` STRING,
    `first_name` STRING,
    `last_name` STRING,
    `city` STRING,
    `country_name` STRING,
    `purchase_date` DATE,
    `delivery_date` DATE,
    `purchase` DECIMAL(10,2),
    `credits` DECIMAL(10,2)
    )
ROW FORMAT SERDE 'org.apache.hive.hcatalog.data.JsonSerDe'
LOCATION '/data/cloudair/sale';

paragraphs.title: 10 - Create managed table sale as ORC format
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.sale;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE cloudair.sale(
    `entry_date` DATE,
    `item` STRING,
    `sales_code` INT,
    `cc_type` STRING,
    `first_name` STRING,
    `last_name` STRING,
    `city` STRING,
    `country_name` STRING,
    `purchase_date` DATE,
    `delivery_date` DATE,
    `purchase` DECIMAL(10,2),
    `credits` DECIMAL(10,2)
    )
COMMENT 'Sale'
STORED AS ORC;

paragraphs.title: 11 - Use an ITAS statement to load data into sale
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
INSERT INTO cloudair.sale SELECT * FROM cloudair.sale_stage;

paragraphs.title: 13 - Create table us_customer_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.us_customer_stage;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE cloudair.us_customer_stage(
    row_id STRING,
    title STRING,
    first_name STRING,
    middle_initial STRING,
    last_name STRING,
    name_set STRING,
    street_address STRING,
    city STRING,
    state STRING,
    state_name STRING,
    zip_code STRING,
    country_id STRING,
    country_name STRING,
    telephone_country_code STRING,
    telephone_number STRING,
    email_address STRING,
    username STRING,
    password STRING,
    national_id STRING,
    mrn STRING,
    insurance_id STRING,
    cc_type STRING,
    cc_number STRING,
    cvv2 STRING,
    cc_expires DATE,
    occupation STRING,
    company STRING,
    domain STRING,
    vehicle STRING,
    gender STRING,
    mothers_maiden STRING,
    birthday DATE,
    tropical_zodiac STRING,
    age STRING,
    eye_color STRING,
    blood_type STRING,
    weight STRING,
    height STRING,
    latitude STRING,
    longitude STRING
    )
ROW FORMAT SERDE 'org.apache.hive.hcatalog.data.JsonSerDe'
LOCATION '/data/cloudair/us_customer'
tblproperties("skip.header.line.count"="1");

paragraphs.title: 14 - Create managed table us_customer as ORC format
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS cloudair.us_customer;

CREATE TABLE cloudair.us_customer(
    row_id INT,
    title STRING,
    first_name STRING,
    middle_initial STRING,
    last_name STRING,
    name_set STRING,
    street_address STRING,
    city STRING,
    state STRING,
    state_name STRING,
    zip_code STRING,
    country_id STRING,
    country_name STRING,
    telephone_country_code STRING,
    telephone_number STRING,
    email_address STRING,
    username STRING,
    password STRING,
    national_id STRING,
    mrn INT,
    insurance_id INT,
    cc_type STRING,
    cc_number STRING,
    cvv2 INT,
    cc_expires DATE,
    occupation STRING,
    company STRING,
    domain STRING,
    vehicle STRING,
    gender STRING,
    mothers_maiden STRING,
    birthday DATE,
    tropical_zodiac STRING,
    age INT,
    eye_color STRING,
    blood_type STRING,
    weight DOUBLE,
    height DOUBLE,
    latitude DOUBLE,
    longitude DOUBLE
    )
STORED AS ORC;

INSERT INTO cloudair.us_customer SELECT * FROM cloudair.us_customer_stage;

paragraphs.title: 21 - Stop NiFi if you are done
paragraphs.text:
%md
If you are done with this lesson, stop the Import from DB to HDFS Grp process group in NiFi. If you are continuing you may leave it running for now and stop it later.

Note that the longer you leave the process group running, the more data will accumulate and loading the data into the Hive tables will take longer. For this reason, you may want to temporarily pause the process group if you are not using it.

%md
#### Delete the raw data
IAW Service Level Agreement (SLA) retain the staging tables but delete the raw data

msg.data:
Delete the raw data

IAW Service Level Agreement (SLA) retain the staging tables but delete the raw data

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Drop Hive Database
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS cloudair CASCADE;

paragraphs.title: Delete the contents of HDFS /data/cloudair
paragraphs.text:
%sh
# Delete data/cloudair
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/cloudair

# Check cloudair db
# What is the desired state? All tables are created in the course of the lab
export PGPASSWORD='BadPass%1'; psql -h db01.cloudair.lan -U devuser -d cloudair -p 5432  <<EOF
\dt

21 - Stop NiFi if you are done
paragraphs.text:
%md
%md
If you are done with this lesson, stop the Import from DB to HDFS Grp process group in NiFi. If you are continuing you may leave it running for now and stop it later.

Note that the longer you leave the process group running, the more data will accumulate and loading the data into the Hive tables will take longer. For this reason, you may want to temporarily pause the process group if you are not using it.

%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully used NiFi to import data into HDFS and created Hive tables to access it.

---

Result
